item.title: The return of cult idea
item.dc:creator: Pug
item.description:
Personally…

Why don’t you let me take over here with some actual well thought out classcards.
This shall be easy.

The Paladin

Blue Dragon Killer
Blessing of Light (Day) - Choose a player, they are immune to attempts the Cult makes to convert them tonight. If you die that night, they will become the new Paladin if they are a member of the Blue Dragon. - 2 uses
Cleanse (Day) Your Test of Faith ability will also kill your target if they a Cult member tonight. If they aren’t, this starts a 2 night cooldown. - Infinite uses
Test of Faith (Night) - Learn if your target is a member of the Cult. - Infinite uses
Smite (Night) If anyone attacks you tonight you will kill them (Bypasses night immunity). - 1 use
Your objective is to defeat the Unseen or Cult, and any neutrals that seek to do you harm.

Converts into The Invoker
Cult Points: 2 - Ability cost: 1
(Blessing of Light) Mithras’s Curse (Day) - The Cult Leader’s Rupture will be unable to be healed tonight (Normal did not require message). - 1 use
(Cleanse) Shade of Mithras (Day) - Target player will appear suspicious to investigators tonight. - Infinite uses
(Test of Faith) Test of Mithras (Night) - Find out targeted player’s class if they are Blue Dragon. - Infinite uses

The Prince

Converts into The Invoker
Cult Points: 3 - Ability costs: 1
Cult Alts:
(Execute) Removal (Night) - Kill the currently jailed player, bypassing all forms of immunity. - 2 uses

(difference of Unstoppable and Fanatic is that stuff like Happy Hours do not work.)
(The moment Prince is known to have executed 2 Blue Dragon is when he is confirmed as scum. so yeah…)

The Alchemist

Converts into The Ritualist
Cult Points: 2 - Ability costs: 1
Cult Alts:
(Stoneskin Potion) Potion of Mithras (Day) - Target player will believe that they are bleeding and if a healer visits they will be “cured”. Healer will get a did not require result though. - 2 uses
(Crimson Potion) Blood of Mithras (Night) - Heal all Cult members tonight - 2 uses

The Fool

Converts into The Apostle
Cult Points: 2 - Ability costs: 1
Cult Alts:
(Poor Fellow) Shameful Cultist (Passive) - If you are executed by the court, One random person who voted you guilty will be Instantly converted to the Cult.
(Foolish) Spread Intelligence (Night) - Warp targeted player’s results. - 4 uses

The Scorned

Converts into The Apostle
Cult Points: 2 - Ability costs: 1

The Possessor

Converts into The Invoker
Cult Points: 2 - Ability costs: 1
Cult Alts:
(Puppet Strings) Master Puppeteer (Night) - Control a player and force them to kill someone. Both of the players will die. Using this will require and use up a use of the Cult Leader’s Eradicate, you cannot use this on the same night that the Cult Leader is using Eradicate. - Infinite uses
(Possess) Possession of Mithras (Night) - Kill the target player. Their class will appear as one of your choice, and they will have information in their logbook of your choosing (or no logbook if nothing is specified). You will know what class they truly were, and what their logbook said. - 1 use

The Reaper

Converts into The Invoker
Cult Points: 2 - Ability costs: 1
Cult Alts:
(Reap) Eradicate Soul (Night) - Occupy target player and prevent heals on them. You will gain one soul when successfully using this ability. You may only steal one soul from a single player. - Infinite uses
(Gathered Darkness) Darkness of Corax (Night) - Kill the target player. Their class will appear as one of your choice, and they will have information in their logbook of your choosing (or no logbook if nothing is specified). You will know what class they truly were, and what their logbook said. - 1 use

The Warlock

Converts into The Invoker
Cult Points: 3 - Ability costs: 1

@techwolves feel free to lower all ability usages if you are going to go with the Sacrifice type of CL. Just please do it on the main FoL classes too if you are going to do so here.
